titles.title: Stormwater Discharge Improvement and Pollution Prevention Act of 1993
To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide for the modification of permitting requirements for discharges composed entirely of stormwater.

bill.summary: 4/1/1993--Introduced. Stormwater Discharge Improvement and Pollution Prevention Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to direct the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue regulations modifying stormwater discharge permit requirements to: (1) provide that a person issued a permit for discharges composed entirely of stormwater will have satisfied treatment requirements if institutional and nonstructural source controls of pollutants are implemented under an approved pollution prevention plan; (2) exempt a facility from all permitting requirements for discharges composed entirely of stormwater if the facility is insignificant in size, the discharges will have a minimal environmental impact, or mitigation efforts are being implemented to prevent pollutants from entering the discharges; and (3) make existing permits and permit applications for discharges composed entirely of stormwater conform to modified requirements. Prohibits thhe Administrator or a State from: (1) requiring or enforcing a permit for discharges composed entirely of stormwater before the effective date of regulations under this Act; and (2) issuing or enforcing a permit which requires the treatment of such discharges before October 1, 2000.
